Wenger on Özil: "I haven’t even seen him. The doctor came to see me & said he had to travel back home, he was in the hotel with us. Certainly he will be short for Wednesday" #Arsenal

Wenger on the win: "We won 1-0, but I’d like to congratulate our 3 centre-backs again, because they did a remarkable job. I give us a merit today because we didn’t concede a goal" #Arsenal

Wenger: "The first half was an even game but in the second half it was all us. We changed our organisation a bit at half-time & I told the players we were at 80% of what we could do. We had to get more out of ourselves in the second half & I think we did that much better" #afc

Wenger: "The draw would have been a disappointment, even if Burnley are a very good team. We were on a high after Tottenham & I think it was important to push on again to strengthen the belief & the ambition of the team" #Arsenal

Wenger on Alexis: "I pushed him more in the middle for the second half & he was much more influential. I felt in the first half as well he was like the team, he didn’t get enough in the game" #Arsenal

Wenger on Wilshere: "I feel he did alright when he came on because he had that little burst to be dangerous. I think he is focused, determined & that’s what we want from him" #Arsenal

Wenger on Wilshere: "I feel he did alright when he came on because he had that little burst to be dangerous. I think he is focused, determined & that’s what we want from him" #Arsenal

Wenger: "It looked a clear penalty, I'll have to watch it again. I can understand they are disappointed. He [Ramsey] didn't throw himself on the ground, he said he wanted to flick the ball on & was pushed in the back." #afc

Wenger on Özil's illness: "I don't know, I haven't even seen him. The doctor came to see me & said he had to travel back home. Certainly he will be short for Wednesday. We will see what it is exactly." #afc

Wenger: "He [Özil] travelled up with us, then travelled back. We brought Maitland-Niles up who arrived at 1pm because we had only 17 players." #afc
